definition: one who provides publicity, press agent
the bursting shells fired from flak

examples: She has taken a good deal of flak for espousing that view.
When I was a restaurant bar manager I sometimes found myself taking flak from my customers for our high prices …

definition: to act as a press agent or promoter for something
examples: … Taylor Swift (Diet Coke), Beyonce (Pepsi) and Steve Harvey (Coke again) have flacked for soda.
The director has been flacking for the up-and-coming stars in her new movie.

definition: to provide publicity for or promote (someone or something)
examples: Since "Born to Run" was published in late September, the author has been flacking it in bookstores and theaters across the country.
